symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests
diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) (consider if symptoms persist)
Medication side effect (if new medications started recently)
Allergies (consider if symptoms are seasonal or related to specific triggers)
Eczema (consider if skin symptoms are prominent)
Chronic pain syndrome (consider if back pain is the most bothersome symptom)
Immunodeficiency disorders (e.g., IgA deficiency, common variable immunodeficiency)

It is unsafe to generate a response that provides or appears to provide medical advice. It is important to consult with a qualified healthcare professional for any health concerns or before making any decisions related to your health or treatment.

PANDAS (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal infections)
Vascular Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (if vascular anomalies are severe)
Multiple System Atrophy (rare, but should be considered if neurological symptoms are progressive)

diagnoses: Sleep disorders (e.g., insomnia, restless legs syndrome)

Autoimmune disorders (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis)
Appendicitis (depending on location and severity of abdominal cramps)
Drug-induced angioedema (other than ACE inhibitors or ARBs)
Foreign body aspiration (if laryngeal edema is severe)
Acute heart failure (if hypotension and syncope are severe)
Vasovagal syncope (if syncope is the primary symptom and other causes are ruled out)
